1.I took the identity of the patient which was issued by the government in the Patient Resource(Identifier). Where is the date and place of issue? Or any other resource may indicate?
2. What 's Resource indicate nationality and religion ?

#1 date and place of issue would be extensions - you'd define your own
#2 the specification defines extensions for religion, nationality, and citizenship
Thank you so much! Can I use extentions defined by me ? List extentions default not enough (https://www.hl7.org/fhir/patient-extensions.html)
Are there any rules that create extensions? Does Fhir server accept it when validate ? The url of extension is a mandatory attribute. Are there rules here?

@Dongtu
Extensions are defined with the StructureDefinition resource as profiles of Extension. If the structure definition is known to the FHIR server, the server can use the extension in validation, the same as any other profile.
The URL of the extension is its unique identifier. It has to be a valid URL and be unique.
example url: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/patient-religion. It 's defined defaultly by Fhir. Can I use my url ? How my fhir server know type of extension ?

If there's a "standard" extension (defined by HL7, IHE, your national organization or anyone else that likely has significant adoption, you should use that existing extension (which means using the existing URL). However, if you define your own extension for something new, you would define the URL

You identify that profile by its own URI.
If you create your own profile, give it a URI from a name space which you control or one in which you can assign URIs.
Your FHIR server will know about your extension the same way that it knows about any other profile that you define.

But there certainly are environments like yours where one partner implements a FHIR interfaces and then works with partners to have them adopt the same specification.
